qas.question: What application lets PS3 users view and organize photographs?

After version 3.4, Picasa was integrated into Photo Gallery along with what social networking site?
Is Photo Gallery automatically or separately installed?
Photo Gallery includes the ability to sort by age, color, or what other unusual criteria for photo software?

What application was introduced in software version 1.60?
What version allows users to upload photos on Snapchat?

What version of PS2 contained Photo Gallery?
After version 4.30, Picasa was integrated into Photo Gallery along with what social networking site?
Is Video Gallery automatically or separately installed?
Photo Gallery excludes the ability to sort by age, color, or what other unusual criteria for photo software?

context: <a0_0><b5_0><b7_0><b9_0>Photo Gallery<b9_0/><b7_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/> is an optional application to view, create and group photos from PS3, which is installed <a3_0><b12_0>separately<b12_0/><a3_0/> from the system software at 105 <b6_0>MB<b6_0/>. It was introduced in system software version <a1_0><b10_0>2.60<b10_0/><a1_0/> and provides a range of tools for sorting through and displaying the system's pictures. The key feature of this application is that it can organize photos into groups according to various criteria. Notable categorizations are colors, ages, or <a4_0><b13_0>facial expressions<b13_0/><a4_0/> of the people in the photos. Slideshows can be viewed with the application, along with music and playlists. The software was updated with the release of system software version <b8_0>3.40<b8_0/> allowing users to upload and browse photos on <a2_0><b11_0>Facebook<b11_0/><a2_0/> and Picasa.
